Def.Name: Norway Maple
Def.Description: Medium tree, 40' - 60' in height; dense, round crown with a trunk up to 24" diameter.
Def.Leaves: Simple, opposite, 4 1/2" - 7" wide and nearly as long. Secretes a milky juice when broken, palmately lobed; lobes, 5, shallow crotches, sharp wavy toothed margins; Light green and the autumn color is usually yellow, occasionally orange-red.
Def.Twigs: The shoots are green at first, soon becoming pale brown; the winter buds are shiny red-brown. Milky sap when cut.
Def.SeedConeOrFruit: Fruit: Samara, 1 1/2" - 2" long, V-shaped pairs with divergent wings, flat, mature in autumn.
Def.Bark: The bark is dark grey and smoother than that of Sugar Maple, becoming ridged on larger trees, but not scaly.
Def.Range: Hardy to zone 4a. Native to eastern and central Europe and southwest Asia, from France east to Russia, north to southern Scandinavia and southeast to northern Iran.
Def.Remarks: Easily confused with Sycamore tree. Can be used for a Bonsai tree.
